III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The facility is a twelve bed residential facility. As there were only nine beds present at
the time of inspection, the facility is initially licensed for nine residents. When additional
beds are in place, the license can be modified to create a twelve bed facility.
The facility was immaculately clean, freshly painted, freshly carpeted, and had new
counters, appliances, and furniture. There is more than adequate indoor and outdoor
recreation space.
B. Program Description
This Transitional Living Center Program will be coordinated by live-in house parents
with a rotating staff presence. Staffing will be at a 6:1 ratio. The Federal Division of
Unaccompanied Children’s Services [DUCS] will refer residents to this residential
treatment program. Initially, some of the already identified residents will be Spanish
speaking 16 and 17-year-old males from Central and South America.
Residency is voluntary and proposed residents have earned placement through their
commitments made while living in refugee camps. Residents are not orphans, but are
not able to live with their families because of issues such as displacement and civil war.
Residents will be taught community living skills as well as receiving a formal education
and language skills. Activities are also provided. Residents work towards independent
living.
The program is identical to the Ridgeview Program that is on Bethany’s Eastern Avenue
Campus and utilizes the same policies and procedures.
All staff records have been reviewed and all staff have been well trained and
appropriately screened.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The facility is in compliance with all licensing rules.
2

IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that a provisional license be issued to this child caring institution,
with an initial capacity of 9.
